alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 7:56AM EDT until September 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Locally one to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront of western Peconic Bay. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor to locally moderate flooding of the more vulnerable locations for western portions of Peconic Bay, mainly in the vicinity of Riverhead. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are possible into this week, particularly during the afternoon/evening high tides for Monday and Tuesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/08 AM 5.2/ 5.7 1.8/ 2.2 2.7/ 3.2 2 NONE 24/08 PM 5.5/ 6.0 2.1/ 2.6 2.2/ 2.7 1 MINOR 25/09 AM 5.5/ 6.0 2.1/ 2.6 2.7/ 3.2 1-2 MINOR 25/09 PM 6.0/ 6.5 2.6/ 3.1 2.7/ 3.2 2 MINOR 26/10 AM 5.7/ 6.2 2.2/ 2.7 2.7/ 3.2 2 MINOR 26/10 PM 5.7/ 6.2 2.2/ 2.7 2.5/ 3.0 1 MINOR ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/06 AM 2.8/ 3.4 -0.2/ 0.3 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE 24/06 PM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.7 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE 25/07 AM 3.0/ 3.5 0.0/ 0.5 0.4/ 0.9 1 NONE 25/07 PM 3.7/ 4.2 0.7/ 1.1 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE 26/08 AM 3.4/ 3.9 0.4/ 0.9 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE 26/08 PM 3.5/ 4.0 0.5/ 1.0 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/07 AM 7.8/ 8.3 0.5/ 1.0 1.6/ 2.0 3 NONE 24/07 PM 8.3/ 8.8 1.0/ 1.5 1.2/ 1.7 2 NONE 25/08 AM 8.1/ 8.6 0.8/ 1.3 1.5/ 2.0 2 NONE 25/09 PM 9.0/ 9.5 1.7/ 2.2 1.7/ 2.2 2 NONE 26/09 AM 8.6/ 9.1 1.3/ 1.8 1.5/ 2.0 2 NONE 26/09 PM 8.8/ 9.3 1.5/ 2.0 1.2/ 1.7 1-2 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
